  • Strong documentation skills
  • Self-starter and proactive
  • Nice to have: pySpark, Typescript

Title: Python Software Developer
Description:
📣 Qim info ?

Qim info is an IT services company based in Switzerland for more than 15 years.

Our agencies in Geneva, Lausanne, Basel and Zurich in Switzerland as well as Annecy in France, together already counts 600 consultants and we are always looking for new talents to join our growing and ambitious company.

At the end of 2021, Qim info obtained the Happy at Work® label !

And ranks 3rd in the ICTJournal ranking in 2022.




📌 In few words

We’re looking for Python Developer




🎯Activities




Develop and maintain small applications satisfying business requirements,
Ensure support of already developed applications, propose solutions to streamline/improve them,
Help and advise users doing development themselves, by providing your expertise and by promoting best practices.




💼 Your profil




University degree in Computer Science, or equivalent
Very good knowledge of Excel and Excel VBA
Good knowledge of Python. Experience with Pandas appreciated.
Good experience on Software Engineering
Hands on experience with 1st or 2nd level support of Business-Critical Applications
Experience in Linux and Windows administration
Experience in writing SQL queries
Java, AWS Cloud Services, Bash scripting, Full Stack development appreciated.
C#, Selenium, Outlook VBA can be useful but not mandatory
Personality: able to work under pressure, result oriented, analytical mindset permitting to quickly identify, and fix issues encountered
Able to support a shift between in 7am and 6pm from our Lausanne office and flexible to stay late in case of exceptional issue.
Languages: Good English Skills, French and/or German a plus.
Collaborative environment that emphasizes a healthy climate in the team.




🏆 Job conditions

Lausanne, Switzerland📍
2 days of remote
Starting date : ASAP 📆




💥Your recruitment

Your first interview with one of our recruiters will be over the phone. The recruiter’s role is to understand your path and listen to your personal and professional aspirations.
Once you have been in contact with our teams, we will organise a technical evaluation of your expertise with one of our staff members.
An in-person interview with a Business Manager will then be organised to introduce you to the assignment or project we think would suit you best.
Finally, after any doubts are cleared up during the previous steps, the recruitment process ends with a hiring proposal.




🙌 Why choose Qim info ?

🛠 Recognized IT expertise in the world of consulting with an activity focused around ten business sectors

🤜🤛 Proximity and quality HR & managerial follow-up with our consultants to support them in their skills development and in their daily mission

🥳 Joining us is also sharing more than a coffee break! Qim tech talks, company evenings, Qim info Weekend… many events are organized each year, enough to create beautiful memories together!




🔎 Want to know more ?

We look forward to your application 😊

Title: Mobile (software) Engineer
Description:
Unser Team setzt sich mit grossem Engagement dafür ein, das Urlaubserlebnis unserer Gäste und Mitglieder von der Buchung über den Aufenthalt bis zur nächsten Ferienplanung zu vereinfachen. Sämtliche Abläufe für Gäste und Mitarbeitende sollen so intuitiv und effizient gestaltet sein, dass sich unsere Gäste nicht nur auf den nächsten Aufenthalt freuen, sondern auch viele wunderbare Erinnerungen mitnehmen und gerne zurückkommen.




Um unsere Mission zu erfüllen, möchten wir unser IT Engineering Team verstärken und suchen einen enthusiastischen und tatkräftigen Teamplayer als




Mobile Software Engineer (w/m/d, 80-100%)




Das erwartet dich

Bei der Implementierung unserer Customer Facing Platforms bist du aktiv in alle Phasen des Entwicklungszyklus eingebunden und arbeitest als Teil unserer Entwicklungsteams eng mit Produktmanagern und UI/UX Spezialisten zusammen
Du trägst gemeinsam mit anderen Ingenieuren zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Inhouse-Lösungen bei, insbesondere im Bereich Mobile Apps
Du erstellst hochwertige Mockups und Prototypen, evaluierst neue Technologien und bringst diese gemeinsam mit dem Team in unsere Lösungen ein
Du arbeitest mit den Backend-Entwicklern zusammen, um Schnittstellen zu entwerfen und Fehler zu beheben
Für diese Stelle ist eine grosse Leidenschaft für die Programmierung, das Testen und die Bereitstellung von qualitativ hochwertigen Anwendungen erforderlich




Das bringst du mit

Abgeschlossenes Studium (FH, Uni, ETH) mit Schwerpunkt Informatik oder eine äquivalente Aus-/Weiterbildung
Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung von mobilen Applikationen
Nachgewiesene Praxis mit cross-platform Technologien, im Speziellen mit React Native und mit native-Development (iOS und Android)
Kenntnisse von Front-End Technologien, wie React, Type-/JavaScript, CSS
Vertraut mit Themen wie Kubernetes, Microservices, Cloud-Infrastruktur, Quality Assurance und CI/CD und auch REST API, Enterprise Applications und UI Testing Tools sind dir bestenfalls nicht fremd
Idealerweise Anwendererfahrung mit agilen Projektmethoden und mit entsprechenden Zertifizierungen (z.B. SAFe, Scrum)
Adressatengerechte, fliessende Verständigung in Englisch (w/s) vorausgesetzt, gute Deutsch– und/oder andere Fremdsprachenkenntnisse von Vorteil
Proaktive, teamorientierte und strukturiert arbeitende Persönlichkeit mit hohem Verantwortungsbewusstsein sowie didaktischem Geschick




Das bieten wir dir

Herausfordernde Aufgaben und eine vielseitige Tätigkeit mit der Chance, dich in einem internationalen Umfeld zu entfalten und zu verwirklichen
Einen modernen Open-Office-Arbeitsplatz am Hapimag-Hauptsitz in Steinhausen (ZG) mit guter Verkehrsanbindung in einem ambitionierten Team
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell (bis zu 40% Remote Work) sowie Möglichkeit, gelegentlich von einem Resort zu arbeiten
Attraktive Mitarbeitervorteile für Ferien in den Hapimag Resorts und weitere Benefits bzgl. Kinderbetreuung und ÖV-Anreise
Förderung der Eigenverantwortung und die Weiterentwicklung unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter




Haben wir Dich überzeugt, Teil unserer Hapimag-Familie und Erfolgsstory zu werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung per LinkedIn oder an career@hapimag.com




Info für Stellenvermittlungen: Für diese Position prüfen und berücksichtigen wir ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen (mit bestehender Arbeitsbewilligung für die Schweiz)

Show more

Title: Senior ML Research Engineer
Description:
Overview

As the Senior ML Research Engineer on the intelligent AV team, you will lead the adoption of cutting-edge machine learning models and algorithms, enhancing the awareness and perception engine behind Q-SYS VisionSuite. In close collaboration with our ML Architect, you will bridge the gap between state-of-the-art research and production systems. You will work alongside talented Software, Robotics, and Machine Learning Engineers to advance the next generation of intelligent audio-video systems for meeting spaces and smart buildings. Your key focus will be on driving innovation, expanding intelligent system capabilities, and shaping our data strategy, including collection and dataset curation, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

Your Mindset

Innovative Thinker: Passionate about staying at the forefront of machine learning advancements and applying them to real-world challenges.

Scientist & Engineer: Driven to bridge the gap between research and practical applications, bringing the latest machine learning solutions into production.

Mentor and Advocate: Actively grow team members’ expertise and excitement about new advances.

This hybrid position is based in Zurich or Athens.

Responsibilities

Drive Innovation: Identify, experiment with, and implement cutting-edge ML algorithms, focusing on situational and perceptual awareness using ML techniques such as computer vision, sensor fusion and multimodal AI

Collaboration & Research Partnerships: Build partnerships with universities at the master’s or PhD level to keep up with state-of-the-art advances.

Integration into Production: Lead the integration of research innovations into production, in collaboration with the ML Architect.

Software Development: Contribute to and collaborate in our codebase following software development best practices.

Strategic Leadership: Inform the ML vision and roadmap, identifying high-impact trends, and develop and align data strategies to support experimentation, training, and evaluation.

Mentorship & Team Growth: Mentor team members, fostering a culture of innovation.

Hiring & Team Growth: Support recruitment efforts to expand the ML team.

Qualifications

Qualifications


PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields, with a focus on machine learning, robotics, or similar.
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience deploying ML research in production environments within a collaborative and cross-disciplinary setting.
At least 1 year of experience leading teams or projects, with strong collaboration and mentorship skills.
Proficiency in Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, or relevant ML frameworks.
Software engineering skills, with experience in Git, code reviews, CI/CD and design patterns.
Experience managing model lifecycles and data pipelines and ensuring real-time performance under constraints.
Academic research collaboration experience, supervising academic research and contributing to successful technology transfers.


Plus


Experience in developing models and algorithms for perception and situational awareness.
Familiarity with MLOps tools like Weights and Biases, MLflow, and experience with Docker.
Experience with ROS and C++.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer / Ingenieur | Basel, CH
Description:
As the premier supplier to our international banking client in Basel, Swisslinx are looking for an experienced Artificial Intelligence Engineer with 5+ years experience and a strong background in data science, machine learning, software engineering, and familiarity with both back-end and front-end technologies.

This is an initial contract running for 12 months with option to extend on a long term basis based on the project road maps, starting by December.

This Artificial Intelligence Engineer will join a small and diverse Data and Analytics Team and collaborate with representatives from Middle Office and users from Front and Back Office.

Responsibilities Will Include


Design AI application architectures and implement Python-based applications for various business use cases.
Design and implement testing and evaluation methodologies for AI applications, focusing on Large Language Model applications.
Collaborate with financial and business teams to understand the organization's financial structure and requirements.
Conduct data exploration and preprocessing to prepare large unstructured datasets for analysis and modeling.
Leverage Azure OpenAI APIs to implement AI applications, optimize their performance, and scale them effectively.
Develop APIs and interfaces for integrating AI models into existing systems and platforms.
Monitor, maintain, and update models as needed to ensure they continue to meet business needs.
Stay updated with the latest AI trends, technologies, and best practices, and explore new tools and techniques to improve project outcomes.


You will possess as many of the following skills as possible:


Around 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist/Engineer or similar role with a focus on machine learning and AI application development and deployment using Python.
Experience in developing services based on Large Language Models, with familiarity in using frameworks such as LangChain and LlamaIndex. Experience with prompt engineering.
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., ChromaDB, Weaviate).
Experience with Python libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, Pydantic, and requests.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, and their off-the-shelf AI functionalities.
Fluency in English.


Nice To Have


Demonstrated experience in the design and development of web applications, with practical experience using Python data application development frameworks such as Streamlit, Plotly Dash, or HoloViz Panel.
Familiarity with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) framework.
Prior experience in developing AI applications in the financial industry.
Certifications in AI or machine learning from recognized institutions like deeplearning.ai or Coursera.
Publications or contributions to open-source projects in the AI or machine learning field.
Master's or PhD in a relevant field.


Please note interviews would be conducted via video call, however the role is based 100% in Switzerland. Our client offers:


The opportunity to work in a diverse and international environment on a long-term basis.
50% working from home.
20 days working remotely from abroad per year.
Modern office in central Basel (50 minutes direct train from Zurich) with subsidised canteen.


Are you interested to work in an international environment in one of the most important financial companies worldwide? Then apply now! We look forward to receiving your full application before the deadline on Tuesday 1 October. #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Software Engineer / Robotics
Description:
cryoWrite designs and manufactures robots for microfluid-based protein purification and fast and lossless nanoL grid writing, preparing biomacromolecules, organelles, or cells for visualization by transmissions cryo-EM. The automated sample preparation provided by our robots removes the main remaining bottleneck in a scalable proteomics pipeline, from cell to structure, which will radically transform the drug discovery process.




Key responsibilities

· Add new features and behavioral patterns and protocols to the cryoWriter robot

· Interface and control hardware with ROS2 (rclpy)

· Integration of sensors and actuators (EtherCAT, Serial)

· Frontend development (PyQt or PySide)

· Optimize control with computer vision (OpenCV, GenICam)




Qualifications, skills, and experience

· Strong development skills in python.

· Able to work autonomously, using and extending existing code base

· Experience of interacting with hardware / sensors / actuators.

· Skilled in writing understandable code, in developing and optimizing applications, and in collaborating via Git.

· English mandatory; German optional.

· Ability to communicate logically and precisely, motivated to contribute your insights and to learn from others.




We offer

A challenging and interesting position, working in an innovative startup company that meets the highest standards and has a product far more advanced than the international competition. You will work on your own projects and participate in a collaborative environment with talented and dedicated people. You can expect versatile tasks, flat hierarchies, and you work together with skilled engineers and highly decorated innovators in the field. You will be an essential member of the team, and you will be able to introduce your visions and ideas and utilize your professional skills to the fullest. You will receive share options as part of your compensation and participate in our success.

cryoWrite is located in Basel. We look forward to receiving your application including your complete documents.

Show more

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote - Switzerland)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more
HTML:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:

  • Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
  • Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
  • A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
  • Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
  • Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
  • Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: Sr. Applied Research Scientist
Description:
Work at Radformation

Cancer rates increase year after year, yet high-quality care is not universal. By automating and standardizing the treatment planning workflow, Radformation aims to create a system where any patient anywhere can receive the same high-quality care.

We strive daily to reduce cancer's global impact and help save more of the 10 million lives it claims each year. Our unwavering commitment is to deliver reliable, high-quality, automated solutions that allow clinics to standardized care for every single person in need.

Radformation is seeking a self-directed Senior Applied Research Scientist to join our innovative and fast moving team. This role is ideal for someone who wishes to develop novel radiotherapy algorithms and use their skills to improve cancer care throughout the world. You will work within Radformation’s fully remote teams to develop analytical dose calculation algorithms and related radiation oncology software.

The Senior Applied Research Scientist is responsible for all aspects of novel algorithm development, including user research, problem statement and definition, prototyping, defining validation methods, validating proposed solutions, documenting algorithm performance, and translating prototypes into engineered solutions together with our software engineering teams.

Applied Scientists are able to take a solution from concept to product. Your research skills, experience, and knowledge will play a key role in helping us design new products for cancer centers.

Responsibilities


Take technical ownership of Radformation proprietary dose calculation algorithms
Work with research and product teams to create new radiotherapy products and algorithms
Test and benchmark Radformation proprietary algorithms against industry standard algorithms





Abilities


Strong understanding of programming concepts with experience using a modern language
Ability to actively communicate with customers and other staff members
Ability to aggregate feedback and requests from clinicians to identify general problems solvable through automated methodologies
Strong organizational and time management skills
Ability to think and act strategically and proactively
Strong writing and presentation skills





Required Experience


Deep understanding of traditional dose calculation methods (Pencil Beam, CVSP, etc)
Able to formulate experiment design and run experiments while developing new algorithms and technology
Able to stay current with state-of-the-art algorithmic techniques
Experience conceiving, implementing, and maintaining clinically used software solutions





Preferred Experience


Deep understanding of Monte Carlo simulation methods used for dose calculation in Radiotherapy





What makes us so RAD?

We take care of our people!

Radformation offers top-tier medical, dental, vision care for employees and their families. Each role comes with our 401(k) & employer match vest immediately and you'll never have to stress about taking the time you need with self-managed PTO. We support our growing RAD families with generous parental leave, along with additional part-time work to help transition back into the swing of things. We are a fully remote team and while we may be apart, virtual events, yearly retreats and a collaborative work environment keep us close and connected.

Cancer transcends any individual differences we may have. That's why at Radformation we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Salary listed is in USD for US-based employees and will be commensurate with experience. Salary range will vary for international candidates and be commensurate with experience and geographical location.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

• Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

• Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

• Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

• Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

• Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

• Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

• Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

• Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

• Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

• Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

• Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

• Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

• Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d, 100%)
Description:
About Liom:

Liom is a Swiss medtech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital medical indicators, allowing to improve your individual health.




What could you build on top of real-time and non-invasive Glucose monitoring? That is what Liom is all about, and we want to beat Apple at it.




Machine learning, personalized health, and predictive medicine. If these areas resonate with you, join us to work on foundational technologic and scientific challenges at Liom. We are a Swiss MedTech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital indicators, to better manage chronic diseases, to customize critical treatments and, to improve your health.




Your mission:

Using proprietary optical sensors, Liom is building a cutting-edge biomedical data generation pipeline to train medical-grade Machine Learning algorithms to infer glucose transcutaneously from spectral measurements. To achieve our vision, our team and advisory board consist of world experts coming from top academic institutions (ETH, EPFL, Columbia, Princeton, or Harvard among others) and industry leaders (Baxter, Roche, Lonza). We are looking for talented, experienced, voraciously curious, and self-driven professionals to join an A-team of doers: https://t.ly/vmCKi




After 4+ years in R&D phase, we are sprinting towards product development phase to launch to market. Therefore, joining as one of the first 60 permanent employees provides you great opportunities for growth in responsibilities and impact.




Responsibilities:

As a Sr. Machine Learning Engineer you will build ML Engineering infrastructure needed to deploy a portfolio of ML models and algorithms on our smartwatch and companion mobile Apps. To be effective in this role, you need to effectively interface with Science (ML Scientists, Data Scientists), Product Development (Electrical Engineering, Photonics, Manufacturing) and Product Management, to acquire and smartly embed multi-disciplinary knowledge into our ML Infrastructure.




You will be joining the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 20 awesome colleagues. You will be working hand-in-hand with an A-team of 3 Software Engineering leaders, coming from the domains of Data, Cloud and App/Web development with a combined 40YOE in tech, plus an amazing and enthusiastic crew of junior engineers.




Your profile:

Master's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent ML experience.
8+ years of experience in writing software working with at least one compiled and one interpreted language such as Python, JavaScript, Java, Go, C, C++
6+ years of Machine Learning Experience in industry developing and deploying ML models in real-world applications.
Proficiency in software development methodologies, version control systems (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines is essential.
In-depth understanding of MLOps principles and best practices, including model versioning, continuous integration and deployment of machine learning models, model monitoring, automated retraining, scalability and resource optimization. Experience with MLOps tools such as Kubeflow, MLflow.
Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Terraform) is beneficial.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities, being comfortable in a dynamic and sometimes ambiguous environment.
The following qualifications are a plus:
Experience with distributed computing platforms (e.g., Spark) and cloud-based machine learning services (e.g., AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud Vertex AI )
Experience with Machine Learning at the Edge (optimization, HW accelerators, GPU, distributed computing)
Compliance and Governance: Understanding of compliance requirements and governance frameworks relevant to machine learning deployments, such as data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and medical device industry-specific standards would be a plus




IMPORTANT: we cannot sponsor working permits for non-EU / EFTA nationals for this role. Applications that do not fulfill this criteria will be automatically rejected.




We offer

Work/Life Balance

Working at a growing MedTech start-up is demanding and our goals are ambitious, which is why our team puts a strong emphasis on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. Therefore, we offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal life.




Values and Mission are important at Liom, as the ultimate goal is to improve people's well-being and we aspire to live that. We will have the chance to discuss value and mission during the interview process.




Diversity

With 18 nationalities in the company, we strive to build a diverse and exciting environment. Within the SMLE team we take special care of gender diversity - currently balanced at 50/50 among the permanent employees- and equal opportunities.




Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We want you to grow with Liom.




Amazing team!

In this role, you will be part of the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 20 awesome colleagues from which you will have the opportunity to learn a lot professionally, but also enjoy great conversations and fresh and well informed points of view. Additionally, you will be working closely with all RnD teams, including Biomedical Science, Biochemistry, Biophotonics, and Electrical Engineering.




Don't forget to check the team on our website!

Our recruitment process

The interview process consists of 3 stages:

Introduction call (20 min - led by hiring manager - remote with video)
Technical Interview (60-90min - led by engineers from the team - remote with video)
On-site interview (90 - 120 min - Culture & Team fit, Lab tour, if role requires meet members from other teams - in person in our office and lab in Pfäffikon)
Show more

Don't forget to check the team on our website!

Our recruitment process

The interview process consists of 3 stages:

  1. Introduction call (20 min - led by hiring manager - remote with video)
  2. Technical Interview (60-90min - led by engineers from the team - remote with video)
  3. On-site interview (90 - 120 min - Culture & Team fit, Lab tour, if role requires meet members from other teams - in person in our office and lab in Pfäffikon)

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
APPLY HERE: Machine Learning Scientist II




Expedia Group brands power global travel for everyone, everywhere. We design cutting-edge tech to make travel smoother and more memorable, and we create groundbreaking solutions for our partners. Our diverse, vibrant, and welcoming community is essential in driving our success.




Why Join Us?

To shape the future of travel, people must come first. Guided by our Values and Leadership Agreements, we foster an open culture where everyone belongs, differences are celebrated and know that when one of us wins, we all win.

We provide a full benefits package, including exciting travel perks, generous time-off, parental leave, a global hybrid work setup (with some pretty cool offices), and career development resources, all to fuel our employees' passion for travel and ensure a rewarding career journey. We’re building a more open world. Join us.




Introduction to team:

This role is for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our growing Machine Learning Science team. We create state of the art machine learning models to make our travel platform more effective and efficient, increasing its relevance for travelers and travel partners (e.g. hotels) worldwide. For example we build models to forecast demand, suggest prices and deals, provide automated conversational AI, and give guided recommendations on how hotels can grow their business on our platform.

We strive to ensure everything we do has measurable business impact. We build innovative algorithms and models that make intelligent, automated decisions, both in batch and in real time. We collaborate closely with the analytics, market management, product and technology teams.

In this position, you will leverage large volumes of data and apply techniques such as machine learning, data mining and econometric modeling to build models and algorithms to enhance software and answer critical business questions. You will use the latest cloud and data technologies to train and deploy your models at scale and support key business initiatives. Outstanding test-and-learn culture is essential to thrive in this fast-moving industry; if you can prove the positive impact of your approaches, you will quickly see them in production.




In this role, you will:

Understand business challenges and formalize them into appropriate machine learning frameworks
Gather and manipulate large volume of data, build datasets, select and engineer model features
Develop, assess, and iteratively improve predictive models using advanced machine learning and statistical methods; Be able to debug and correct data assumptions through testing
Collaborate with business partners, program management, and engineering teams to ensure that solutions meet business needs and have functional feasibility and robustness
Communicate in a clear and concise manner to your peers and business stakeholders
Develop a good understanding of the industry, our data landscape and how data science can help optimize the work of our business partners
Keep abreast of latest data science development and share knowledge with the team
Fulfill ad-hoc requests for data and analysis.




Experience and qualifications:

MSc or PhD in a quantitative field like machine learning, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics/physics
Hands-on experience with various machine learning and econometrics algorithms, with proven ability to extract and combine data from multiple sources, converting raw data into automated, actionable insights
Expertise in Python, R or Scala; good programing practice, ability to write readable, fast code
Facility with SQL-like query language to do data extraction, transformation and loading
Experience working with large datasets in a distributed environment like Hadoop or Spark and with cloud services (AWS, Qubole, Databricks) a plus
Ability to understand a business problem, identify key challenges, formalize the problem from a data and algorithm perspective, and prototype solutions
High intellectual curiosity and willingness to tackle complex/technical problems to generate actionable business insights
Strong verbal and visual communication skills.




Accommodation requests

If you need assistance with any part of the application or recruiting process due to a disability, or other physical or mental health conditions, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request.

We are proud to be named as a Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2024 and be recognized for award-winning culture by organizations like Forbes, TIME, Disability:IN, and others.

Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™. © 2024 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50

Employment opportunities and job offers at Expedia Group will always come from Expedia Group’s Talent Acquisition and hiring teams. Never provide sensitive, personal information to someone unless you’re confident who the recipient is. Expedia Group does not extend job offers via email or any other messaging tools to individuals with whom we have not made prior contact. Our email domain is @expediagroup.com. The official website to find and apply for job openings at Expedia Group is careers.expediagroup.com/jobs.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.




We are proud supporters of Women in Data®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.




Show more

  • Expertise in Python, R or Scala; good programing practice, ability to write readable, fast code
  • Facility with SQL-like query language to do data extraction, transformation and loading
  • Experience working with large datasets in a distributed environment like Hadoop or Spark and with cloud services (AWS, Qubole, Databricks) a plus
  • Ability to understand a business problem, identify key challenges, formalize the problem from a data and algorithm perspective, and prototype solutions
  • High intellectual curiosity and willingness to tackle complex/technical problems to generate actionable business insights
  • Strong verbal and visual communication skills.


Accommodation requests

If you need assistance with any part of the application or recruiting process due to a disability, or other physical or mental health conditions, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request.

We are proud to be named as a Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2024 and be recognized for award-winning culture by organizations like Forbes, TIME, Disability:IN, and others.

Title: DevOps Engineer with IAM focus 80%-100%, permanent
Description:
The Swiss National Supercomputing Centre (CSCS) develops and operates cutting-edge, high-performance computing (HPC) systems as an essential service facility for science. The centre enables world-class research through its scientific user lab, which is available to domestic and international researchers in academia, industry, and the business sector. The centre is operated by ETH Zurich and has offices in Lugano (headquarters) and Zurich.

Project background

Identity and Access Management (IAM) solutions are essential to CSCS research infrastructure. Reliable services, seamless integrations, and well-defined policies, supported by high-quality assets, provide the foundation for our advanced use cases.

To this end, we are hiring a DevOps Engineer (with IAM focus) for our offices in Zurich or Lugano.

In this role, you will be involved in activities such as:


Manage and configure IAM services, including KeyCloak, WSO2 API Gateway, Waldur, OpenLDAP;
Design and develop extensions, integrations, automations and monitoring solutions;
Conduct proof-of-concepts to evaluate products, followed by implementation and adoption projects.


This position extends a multi-disciplinary team of highly skilled engineers focused on delivering IAM services.

Responsibilities include designing, installing, configuring, operating, and supporting services like Keycloak, as well as developing extensions, integrations, automations, and monitoring tools. You will engineer solutions to manage the inherent complexity of this domain, which typically limits the flexibility and scalability of IT services in multi-tenant and federated environments.

Profile

The ideal candidate has a background in both software development and systems administration, with a keen interest in IAM topics.

Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science or related fields;
Experience in software engineering, ideally with Python or Java, and through modern practices (e.g., CI/CD);
Experiences deploying and operating services in Linux and Kubernetes environments;
Interest in configuring standards like OAuth2, SAML, OpenID, and LDAP using open-source tools such as OpenLDAP and Keycloak


Additional Aspects That Make You Stand Out:


Familiarity with IAM products like Keycloak, WSO2 Identity Server, Waldur, OpenLDAP, and similar;
Experience in federated and multi-tenant environments;
Practical knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies;
Experience managing database services (e.g., MySQL);
Proficiency with modern automation tools;
Experience with HPC systems.


Workplace

Workplace

We offer

In an organization that values autonomy, ownership and continuous learning, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to gain specialized hands-on experience through activities characterized by the challenging aspects typical of the HPC field.

Furthermore,


ETH Zurich is a family-friendly employer with excellent and flexible working conditions.
You can look forward to an exciting working environment, cultural diversity and attractive offers and benefits.
We value the diversity of our team and, to further enhance the diversity of our workforce, we particularly encourage women to apply.


In line with our values , ETH Zurich encourages an inclusive culture. We promote equality of opportunity, value diversity and nurture a working and learning environment in which the rights and dignity of all our staff and students are respected. Visit our Equal Opportunities and Diversity website to find out how we ensure a fair and open environment that allows everyone to grow and flourish.

Curious? So are we.

Please Include The Following Documents With Your Application:


CV
Relevant certificates and diplomas


To further enhance the diversity of our workforce, we particularly encourage women to apply.

We look forward to receiving your online application, including a letter of motivation, CV, diplomas, and employment certificates. Please address your application to Ms Stephanie Frequente, CSCS Human Resources, Via Trevano 131, 6900 Lugano.

Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered.

Further information about CSCS can be found on our website . Questions regarding the position should be directed to Stefano Schuppli, schuppli@cscs.ch (no applications).

ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universities specialising inscience and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education,cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledgeinto society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find ouruniversity to be a place that promotes independent thinking and anenvironment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe,yet forging connections all over the world, we work together todevelop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
Join the Future of Sensor Technology at AlpsenTek!




About Us: AlpsenTek is an innovative and well-funded startup, uniting the expertise of seasoned professionals from Switzerland and China. We're pioneering advanced sensor development and are in search of talented Engineers to fortify our dynamic team.




Responsibilities

Utilize your experience and knowledge in computer vision and machine learning to develop innovative techniques for ApsenTek's hybrid vision sensor.
Conduct researches and prototype algorithms that harness the potential of both event and RGB visual outputs from ApsenTek's sensor.
Drive the implementation and deployment of algorithms on our real-time platforms, showcasing their functionality through practical applications.




Education

MSc or PhD in computer science, data science, robotics, electrical engineering, mathematics, or a related field.




Experience, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

Proven expertise through theoretical research and hands-on experience in developing computer vision and machine learning algorithms. This includes, but is not limited to, tasks such as image and video processing, image/video quality enhancement, object detection, segmentation, and tracking.
Abilities to write well-organized and reliable Python or C++ code, along with practical experience in implementing and training deep learning models using PyTorch.
Passion for addressing computer vision challenges, involving problem definition, issue analysis, effective communication with colleagues for support, and independently exploring solutions based on your knowledge.
Effective written and oral communication skills in English to facilitate clear and concise collaboration within amulti-cultural team.




Non-Mandatory but very welcome skills

Experience with event cameras
Experience of developing algorithms for vision sensors or hardware systems
Chinese




What we offer

AlpsenTek is a young and well-funded startup with experienced professional teams based in both Zürich, Switzerland and China. Our algorithm team at AlpsenTek is actively seeking a candidate to contribute to the evolution of our state-of-the-art hybrid vision sensor.

We offer an exceptional opportunity to work in a world-class team in the field of cutting-edge vision SoC (System on Chips). We are looking for an enquiring and motivated student willing to tackle today’s advanced computer vision challenges in advanced vision senser design and work in a dynamic and innovative environment.

HTML:
Join the Future of Sensor Technology at AlpsenTek!


About Us: AlpsenTek is an innovative and well-funded startup, uniting the expertise of seasoned professionals from Switzerland and China. We're pioneering advanced sensor development and are in search of talented Engineers to fortify our dynamic team.


Responsibilities

  • Utilize your experience and knowledge in computer vision and machine learning to develop innovative techniques for ApsenTek's hybrid vision sensor.
  • Conduct researches and prototype algorithms that harness the potential of both event and RGB visual outputs from ApsenTek's sensor.
  • Drive the implementation and deployment of algorithms on our real-time platforms, showcasing their functionality through practical applications.


Education

  • MSc or PhD in computer science, data science, robotics, electrical engineering, mathematics, or a related field.


Experience, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

  • Proven expertise through theoretical research and hands-on experience in developing computer vision and machine learning algorithms. This includes, but is not limited to, tasks such as image and video processing, image/video quality enhancement, object detection, segmentation, and tracking.
  • Abilities to write well-organized and reliable Python or C++ code, along with practical experience in implementing and training deep learning models using PyTorch.
  • Passion for addressing computer vision challenges, involving problem definition, issue analysis, effective communication with colleagues for support, and independently exploring solutions based on your knowledge.
  • Effective written and oral communication skills in English to facilitate clear and concise collaboration within amulti-cultural team.


Non-Mandatory but very welcome skills

  • Experience with event cameras
  • Experience of developing algorithms for vision sensors or hardware systems
  • Chinese


What we offer

AlpsenTek is a young and well-funded startup with experienced professional teams based in both Zürich, Switzerland and China. Our algorithm team at AlpsenTek is actively seeking a candidate to contribute to the evolution of our state-of-the-art hybrid vision sensor.

We offer an exceptional opportunity to work in a world-class team in the field of cutting-edge vision SoC (System on Chips). We are looking for an enquiring and motivated student willing to tackle today’s advanced computer vision challenges in advanced vision senser design and work in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Per supportare un nostro partner del settore assicurativo, siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Scientist appassionato/a di machine learning, intelligenza artificiale e modelli analitici. La risorsa che cerchiamo avrà maturato minimo 2 anni di esperienza nel campo dell’analisi e modellizzazione dei dati.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea Magistrale in Matematica e Fisica, Statistica, Ingegneria, Data Science o equivalenti;
  • Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python o R e di sviluppo in ambienti containerizzati;
  • Autonomia e conoscenza dei principi fondamentali di statistica e machine learning;
  • Familiarità con l'utilizzo di librerie di data science come Scikit-learn, TensorFlow o PyTorch;
  • Eccellenti abilità nella manipolazione dei dati e nell'utilizzo di database SQL e NoSQL.
  • Competenze di Data Mining, costruzione algoritmi di Machine Learning, utilizzo di strumenti di data visualization.

Costituiscono un plus la conoscenza dei principali cloud provider (preferibilmente GCP e AWS), conoscenza delle principali soluzioni per la creazione di API REST come Flask e FastAPI e una buona padronanza della lingua inglese.


Cosa offriamo:


  • Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, dinamico e giovane;
  • Contratto full-time a tempo indeterminato
  • Corsi di formazione;
  • Iniziative di team building;
  • Assicurazione sanitaria;
  • Welcome kit.


Completano il profilo una forte attitudine alla comunicazione e al coinvolgimento, buone doti relazionali e organizzative, dinamicità, creatività e forte orientamento al raggiungimento degli obiettivi.


Sede di lavoro: Roma, ibrido



CONTRADER è una società con esperienza pluriennale in ambito ICT, esperta nella realizzazione di progetti e nella consulenza aziendale ad altissima specializzazione nel settore ICT e nello Sviluppo di Componenti Software.

La società sta crescendo tantissimo senza perdere l’energia della startup. In tutto quello che facciamo ricerchiamo l’innovazione: nelle tecnologie, nelle idee per i clienti e nell’organizzazione. Il nostro capitale sono le persone dinamiche e di talento. L’innovazione e la flessibilità che caratterizza il nostro lavoro quotidiano ci consentono di raggiungere obiettivi sfidanti ed essere presenti con le nostre proposte commerciali e i nostri servizi su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
TopNetwork S.p.A è alla ricerca un Data Science Specialist con le seguenti caratteristiche:




Conoscenza approfondita di Python e framework di ML e DL come TensorFlow e Pytorch
Conoscenza dei principali algoritmi di ML e DL
Conoscenza approfondita delle tecniche di Computer Vision e riconoscimento immagini
Conoscenza delle architetture distribuite e i principali protocolli di scambio dati come MQTT e HTTP
Esperienza nello sviluppo di software su microcontrollori come Arduino e relativa sensoristica
Conoscenza dell’Edge Computing e il loro utilizzo nell’ambito IoT
Conoscenza dell’ambiente Docker
Conoscenza del sistema operativo Linux
Capacità di analizzare problemi complessi e trovare soluzioni innovative
Capacità di scrivere documentazione tecnica di progetto




E' richiesta Laurea ad indirizzo informatico




Chi Siamo

TopNetwork s.p.a è un’azienda leader nel settore ICT ad alta Innovazione tecnologica, collocata tra i principali player per grandi aziende e istituzioni sul territorio nazionale.

Le nostre soluzioni integrano l’Intelligenza Artificiale con altre tecnologie (blockchain, Cloud, Data Science, Internet of Things) e spaziano dalla Robotica ai sistemi satellitari, ai sistemi di analisi visiva, ai motori di ricerca semantica e machine learning.

Una realtà stabile, riconosciuta e radicata sul mercato con 8 sedi operative aziendali in Italia e con un organico di più di 700 dipendenti.

Lo scorso anno siamo entrati nel gruppo internazionale SMART4ENGINEERING, che raccoglie realtà focalizzate in aree complementari dell’ingegneria digitale e della R&D, per consentire ai clienti di affrontare la digital trasformation.

Il gruppo SMART4 è impegnato su progetti di scala Europea (Italia, Francia, Spagna, Portogallo e Tunisia) con un organico di più di 3500 dipendenti--> https://www.smart4engineering.com/




Cosa offriamo:

Possibilità di accedere a contenuti formativi multilingua;
Possibilità di accedere a diverse piattaforme e-learning per accrescere le competenze tecniche e quelle trasversali;
Percorsi di accompagnamento alla certificazione;
Retribuzioni commisurate a seniority e profilo professionale del candidato;
Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa;
Welfare aziendale annuale;
Possibilità di inserirsi in una realtà in espansione, solida, affidabile, dinamica e flessibile, dove poter esprimere le proprie attitudini;
Inserimento in un team di professionisti che si riconosce dalla disponibilità, puntualità nelle risposte, competenza, capacità di apprendere dalle lesson learned, creatività nella soluzioni;
Correttezza e integrità: crediamo nell’etica del lavoro, quindi nella condivisione di obiettivi e in un rapporto quanto più possibile autentico con i nostri collaboratori.




Sede di lavoro: Roma (Ibrido con due giorni di presenza a settimana)




Si prega di inviare il CV dettagliato con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali (ai sensi degli artt. 12, 13 e 14 del Regolamento EU 2016/679).

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Tale annuncio è, inoltre, rivolto a tutti i facenti parte di Categorie Protette, legge 68/99.

HTML:
TopNetwork S.p.A è alla ricerca un Data Science Specialist con le seguenti caratteristiche:


  • Conoscenza approfondita di Python e framework di ML e DL come TensorFlow e Pytorch
  • Conoscenza dei principali algoritmi di ML e DL
  • Conoscenza approfondita delle tecniche di Computer Vision e riconoscimento immagini
  • Conoscenza delle architetture distribuite e i principali protocolli di scambio dati come MQTT e HTTP
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di software su microcontrollori come Arduino e relativa sensoristica
  • Conoscenza dell’Edge Computing e il loro utilizzo nell’ambito IoT
  • Conoscenza dell’ambiente Docker
  • Conoscenza del sistema operativo Linux
  • Capacità di analizzare problemi complessi e trovare soluzioni innovative
  • Capacità di scrivere documentazione tecnica di progetto


E' richiesta Laurea ad indirizzo informatico


Chi Siamo

TopNetwork s.p.a è un’azienda leader nel settore ICT ad alta Innovazione tecnologica, collocata tra i principali player per grandi aziende e istituzioni sul territorio nazionale.

Le nostre soluzioni integrano l’Intelligenza Artificiale con altre tecnologie (blockchain, Cloud, Data Science, Internet of Things) e spaziano dalla Robotica ai sistemi satellitari, ai sistemi di analisi visiva, ai motori di ricerca semantica e machine learning.

Una realtà stabile, riconosciuta e radicata sul mercato con 8 sedi operative aziendali in Italia e con un organico di più di 700 dipendenti.

Lo scorso anno siamo entrati nel gruppo internazionale SMART4ENGINEERING, che raccoglie realtà focalizzate in aree complementari dell’ingegneria digitale e della R&D, per consentire ai clienti di affrontare la digital trasformation.

Il gruppo SMART4 è impegnato su progetti di scala Europea (Italia, Francia, Spagna, Portogallo e Tunisia) con un organico di più di 3500 dipendenti--> https://www.smart4engineering.com/


Cosa offriamo:

  • Possibilità di accedere a contenuti formativi multilingua;
  • Possibilità di accedere a diverse piattaforme e-learning per accrescere le competenze tecniche e quelle trasversali;
  • Percorsi di accompagnamento alla certificazione;
  • Retribuzioni commisurate a seniority e profilo professionale del candidato;
  • Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa;
  • Welfare aziendale annuale;
  • Possibilità di inserirsi in una realtà in espansione, solida, affidabile, dinamica e flessibile, dove poter esprimere le proprie attitudini;
  • Inserimento in un team di professionisti che si riconosce dalla disponibilità, puntualità nelle risposte, competenza, capacità di apprendere dalle lesson learned, creatività nella soluzioni;
  • Correttezza e integrità: crediamo nell’etica del lavoro, quindi nella condivisione di obiettivi e in un rapporto quanto più possibile autentico con i nostri collaboratori.


Sede di lavoro: Roma (Ibrido con due giorni di presenza a settimana)


Si prega di inviare il CV dettagliato con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali (ai sensi degli artt. 12, 13 e 14 del Regolamento EU 2016/679).

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Tale annuncio è, inoltre, rivolto a tutti i facenti parte di Categorie Protette, legge 68/99.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS

1 October 2024-23:59-GMT+01:00 Central European Time (Rome)

WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.

About Wfp

The World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP's values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.

To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org and follow us on social media to keep up with our latest news: YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter.

WHY JOIN WFP?


WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.
WFP invests in the personal & professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.
A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).


Background And Purpose Of The Assignment

The Data Science team within the Forecasting & Early Warning Unit, in the Analysis Planning and Performance (APP) division, is a specialized team dedicated to addressing the challenge of modelling and forecasting food insecurity and its drivers, through the innovative application of AI and data science techniques. By leveraging large heterogenous datasets and advanced algorithms, the team can identify patterns and trends that are not immediately apparent and predict the impact of impending natural and human generated hazards, enabling timely interventions and anticipatory actions in vulnerable areas. The work is crucial in facilitating data-driven decision-making for governments and humanitarian organizations, allowing proactive strategies in combating food crises and their underlying causes. This approach helps to mitigate the impact of potential crises on affected populations, improving resilience and ensuring food security.

The Early Warning and Forecasting Unit is developing an early warning tool to detect impending food crises, with initial pilots in high-priority countries. Working with the private sector, this project will harnesses expertise in artificial intelligence and product innovation alongside WFP's operational insights and localized data. The objective is to generate early warning signals that facilitate proactive interventions, integrating real-time data, satellite imagery, news data streams, and Google analytics to enhance response capabilities and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of efforts to prevent food crises in vulnerable communities. As part of the team, the Data Scientist will be responsible of designing and developing advanced AI solutions to analyze trends and forecast potential crises, producing early warning signals. The models will be developed in production-ready code to ensure smooth maintenance and deployment. The role will also require to collaborate closely with stakeholders to tailor the tool specifically to the needs and conditions of the target regions, ensuring its effectiveness and relevance.

Accountabilities/Responsibilities

The Consultant will be responsible for the following activities:


Research, design and implement AI models for estimating food insecurity and produce early warning of impending crises.
Support ad-hoc data explorations and analysis for the project, by means of traditional statistical analysis as well as state-of-the-art data science methodologies.
In collaboration with the software engineering team, support the design and the implementation of production-ready data pipelines.
Support the writing of technical papers and reports to be submitted to peer-reviewed international journals.
Participate in workshops, meetings and conferences to present the technical aspects of the project, within the organization and externally.
Ensure adherence to WFP policies regarding data, including data privacy, security, management, and code documentation.
Participate in field missions to WFP country offices as required.
Perform other tasks as required.


Deliverables At The End Of The Contract


Technical inputs to the development of Early Warning System, including the code and methodology for generation of the signals.
Deployment of AI models in a production environment
Maintenance of the code base following industry’s best practices.
Submission of research papers to high impact journals.
Participation in project meetings, scientific committee meetings and dissemination events
Presentations on the technical aspects of the project, as needed.


Education

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics or similar.

Experience

At least 5 years of professional experience in a data science-related role, including PhDs and other academic positions.

Knowledge & Skills


Python programming skills and experience with data science libraries (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, Keras, etc)
Advanced knowledge of statistics and passion for machine learning with an understanding of algorithms
Experience in deploying and maintaining AI solution in Cloud Environments
Experience in querying SQL databases is required
Experience in git is required
Experience in the following fields is an asset: forecasting Time Series; NLP; Generative AI; Deep Learning Libraries (PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Knowledge of survey methodologies is an asset
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively and respectfully in a diverse and multicultural team environment


Languages

Excellent spoken and written English. French or Arabic is an asset.

WFP LEADERSHIP FRAMEWORK

WFP Leadership Framework guides to the common standards of behavior that guide HOW we work together to accomplish our mission.

Click here to access WFP Leadership Framework

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION

WFP is dedicated to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our recruitment process is inclusively crafted to welcome candidates of all backgrounds, celebrating diversity and ensuring a respectful environment for all. We aim for an accessible and fair recruitment journey. Should you need any reasonable accommodations or have accessibility concerns, please reach out to us confidentially at global.inclusion@wfp.org. Our DEI team is here to ensure your full participation in our recruitment process.

NO FEE DISCLAIMER

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

REMINDERS BEFORE YOU SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION


We strongly recommend that your profile is accurate, complete, and includes your employment records, academic qualifications, language skills and UN Grade (if applicable).
Once your profile is completed, please apply, and submit your application.
Please make sure you upload your professional CV in the English language
Kindly note the only documents you will need to submit at this time are your CV and Cover Letter
Additional documents such as passport, recommendation letters, academic certificates, etc. may potentially be requested at a future time
Please contact us at global.hrerecruitment@wfp.org in case you face any challenges with submitting your application
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified


All employment decisions are made on the basis of organizational needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications. WFP is committed to providing an inclusive work environment free of sexual exploitation and abuse, all forms of discrimination, any kind of harassment, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. Therefore, all selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

No appointment under any kind of contract will be offered to members of the UN Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), International Civil Service Commission (ICSC), FAO Finance Committee, WFP External Auditor, WFP Audit Committee, Joint Inspection Unit (JIU) and other similar bodies within the United Nations system with oversight responsibilities over WFP, both during their service and within three years of ceasing that service.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Siamo una Data Driven Transformation Company specializzata in design e delivery di soluzioni, metodologie, algoritmi e tecnologie capaci di trasformare e potenziare le aziende clienti con la valorizzazione del principale e più abbondante asset del mercato odierno: i dati.

La nostra realtà nasce da un gruppo di ricercatori universitari e siamo oggi partner strategico di oltre 200 aziende clienti e di tutti i più importanti vendor tecnologici internazionali. Abbiamo all’attivo più di 1.500 progetti di successo realizzati in oltre 20 anni di crescita costante e continua.

Con sedi a Bologna, Roma, Milano e Napoli, abbiamo una struttura di oltre 450 professionisti altamente specializzati.

Grazie ai servizi di Advisory, Application Maintenance, Big Data Platform, Integrated Platforms, Blockchain, Business Analytics, Location Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, Performance Management e Customer Data Platform supportiamo tutti i livelli aziendali dei nostri clienti dando forma e concretezza alla loro visione.

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Scientist appassionato di machine learning, modelli analitici e intelligenza artificiale. La risorsa che cerchiamo avrà maturato almeno 4 anni di esperienza nel campo dell’analisi e modellazione dei dati, presso primarie realtà consulenziali o di industry.

In particolare, si occuperà di:

  • Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti;
  • Progettazione e creazione di algoritmi avanzati di machine learning e deep learning, in particolare in cloud;
  • Utilizzo di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati;
  • Proporre soluzioni innovative in ambito analytics;
  • Progettare e implementare data pipelines per integrare dati eterogenei in un’unica piattaforma;
  • Sviluppo di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning;
  • Gestione end to end di progetti analitici: dall’esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi;
  • Creazione di dashboard e insight per semplificare il processo decisionale degli stakeholder.

Requisiti:

  • Laurea magistrale STEM (Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Statistica, Matematica o affini), costituisce titolo preferenziale il possesso di un PhD;
  • 4 anni di esperienza in posizione analoga, sarà considerato preferenziale se in contesto consulenziale;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie per la manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli;
  • Comprovata conoscenza dei modelli di machine learning realizzata su piattaforme cloud;
  • Esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti;
  • Buona conoscenza delle architetture e tecnologie moderne in ambito dati e AI, advanced analytics e machine learning;
  • Esperienza nel coordinamento di un team di progetto.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (almeno B2)

Sarà considerato un plus la conoscenza di varie tecnologie che spaziano tra:

  • Piattaforme DataLakehouse (databricks, snowflake);
  • Piattaforme Cloud per Analytics (AWS, Azure, Google);
  • Database relazionali (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle);
  • Data processing (Apache Spark);
  • Strumenti di ETL e di API Management;
  • Buone competenze comunicative anche verso stakeholder non tecnici.

Ricerchiamo persone che, oltre alle qualità tecniche, abbiano una forte motivazione, una grande passione per l'innovazione, e che si distinguano per entusiasmo, impegno, spirito di iniziativa e sguardo al futuro.

Altre informazioni:

Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

Ai candidati selezionati verrà offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

Sede di lavoro: Roma

Inquadramento: contratto di lavoro dipendente a tempo indeterminato

Perché scegliere Iconsulting?

Together we spark!

Lavorare in Iconsulting è un percorso di crescita sfidante e motivante. Crediamo in un modello di collaborazione in cui instaurare un rapporto duraturo di fiducia con i nostri collaboratori e clienti. Potrai lavorare in modo flessibile e per obiettivi grazie a una politica consolidata di lavoro Agile, vivendo le tue giornate lavorative in spazi aziendali moderni e accoglienti.

I candidati ambosessi (D.lgs. n. 198/2006) sono invitati ad inviare il curriculum comprensivo di autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell’art. 13 del Decreto Legislativo 30 giugno 2003, n. 196 “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
TLa risorsa a diretto riporto del Responsabile della funzione Attuariato Danni si occuperà delle seguenti attività:

modellizzazione dei rischi CAT e più in generale connessi con gli eventi naturali
supporto allo sviluppo tariffario, alle analisi di fabbisogno e di profittabilità dei prodotti Danni (Auto e Non Auto), promuovendo lo sviluppo e la sofisticazione delle tecniche di modellizzazione statistica e predittiva già in uso
ricerca e sviluppo finalizzata alla definizione e successiva implementazione di nuove soluzioni tecniche che favoriscano la redditività del business
supporto alle attività previste in ambito POG e Value for Money per i prodotti Danni, Auto e Non Auto




Requisiti richiesti:

Laurea in Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria o equivalenti
padronanza degli approcci metodologici di tipo “data science”
conoscenza delle teorie dell’inferenza statistica e della statistica multivariata
padronanza dell’applicativo Python
ottima conoscenza di Microsoft Office
buona conoscenza della lingua inglese




Requisiti preferenziali:

Specializzazione in ambito modellizzazione dei rischi catastrofali e/o ambito meteorologico
conoscenza applicativi statistici SAS
familiarità con i software di modelizzazione (Emblem/Radar/Classifier)
conoscenza altri applicativi (R/Mathlab etc)
conoscenza della lingua francese




Si offre:

inquadramento previsto dal vigente C.C.N.L. delle imprese di assicurazione, condizioni economiche e benefit di sicuro interesse.




Sede di lavoro: Roma




L’offerta di lavoro si intende estesa a entrambi i sessi (L.903/77)

Per Groupama la diversità è un valore e per questo motivo ci impegnano quotidianamente a garantire un ambiente inclusivo. Le candidature sono prese in considerazione garantendo pari opportunità indipendentemente da genere, identità e orientamento di genere, etnia, religione, età, disabilità, nel rispetto di quanto previsto dalla normativa italiana, europea e internazionale.
